result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael A. Washington is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael A. Washington was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Michael A. Washington was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:26 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Washington in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to felony possession of THC (2nd offense) - Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Burns moves to return $1129 cash and gun seized during arrest be returned to defendant - Court denies motion to release gun and brass knuckles. Court orders court costs to be taken out of cash seized - Sheriff to release cash to defendant - defendant must immediately pay court costs at Clerk of Court's office; defendant must go directly from Sheriff's Dept to Clerk of Court's office to pay costs.
Court sentence
WHS/POP - 18 months each count concurrent
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail credit - 1 day if revoked
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Appeal rights given. NADVI given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:44 p.m.

3:47 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Washington in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns - In receipt of Information - waive further reading - enters not guilty pleas. Bail continued. Adj. 3:48 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

3:27 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Washington in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns statement to defendant's non-appearance.  Court quashes warrant - reinstates bond. Adj. 3:28 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
3:40 p.m. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not in court - Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 3:40 pm.

9:32 a.m. Defendant Michael A. Washington in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Officer James Robbins, RPD, sworn, direct. Witness identifies defendant. Cross by Burns. Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over for trial. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:03 p.m Defendant Michael A. Washington in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - 
Bail continued. Adj. 3:04 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael A. Washington in court, via video in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:49
In receipt, right to counsel - would like counsel
Michlig to bail - Court questions defendant - Defendant statement - Court sets sig bond
Defendant statement  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
